item.title: Accuracy of reconstruction of spike-trains with two near-colliding nodes
Geometry of error amplification in solving the Prony system with near-colliding nodes
item.description: Reference Andrey Akinshin, Gil Goldman, Yosef Yomdin “Geometry of error amplification in solving the Prony system with near-colliding nodes” (2021) // Mathematics of Computation. Vol. 90. No 327. Pp. 267–302. DOI: 10.1090/mcom/3571 Abstract We consider a reconstruction problem for “spike-train” sig nals F of the a priori known form F ( x ) = ∑ d j =1 a j $\delta$ ( x − x j ) , from their moments m k ( F ) = ∫ x k F ( x ) dx. We assume m k ( F ) to be known for k = 0 , 1 , . . . , 2 d − 1 , with an absolute error not exceeding ǫ \textgreater 0. This problem is essentially equivalent to solving the Prony system ∑ d j =1 a j x k j = m k ( F ) , k = 0 , 1 , . . . , 2 d − 1 . We study the “geometry of error amplification” in reconstruc tion of F from m k ( F ) , in situations where the nodes x 1 , . . . , x d near-collide, i.e. form a cluster of size h ≪ 1. We show that in this case error amplification is governed by the “Prony leaves” S q F, in the parameter space of signals F , along which the first q + 1 moments remain constant. On this base we produce accurate , up to the constants, lower and upper bounds on the worst case r econstruction error, and show how the Prony leaves can help in improving rec onstruction accuracy.
